intro: Dracaena anerleyensis, commonly known as the Anerley dracaena, is a rare and unique plant native to the island of Saint Helena in the South Atlantic Ocean. It is characterized by its striking, spirally arranged leaves that form a dense rosette, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are followed by red, fleshy fruits. Dracaena anerleyensis is adapted to the humid, coastal conditions of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat threats, it is considered a critically endangered species.
